summary:
USER_CONTEXT: Fix misleading AttributeError messages in subclassed SkyCoord when properties access non-existent attributes

TASK_TRACKING: 
COMPLETED: 
- Initial problem analysis and understanding
- Repository exploration and structure identification  
- Located target file: sky_coordinate.py with __getattr__ method at line 869
- Found error location: lines 898-900 in __getattr__ method
- Created reproduction script and confirmed issue behavior

PENDING:
- Examine the actual __getattr__ implementation in detail
- Understand why property access triggers __getattr__ with property name
- Design and implement fix for misleading error messages
- Create comprehensive test cases
- Validate fix works correctly
- Submit changes

CURRENT_STATE: 
- Working directory: /tmp/tmp_qu0p03y/astropy
- Issue confirmed: When subclassed SkyCoord property accesses non-existent attribute, error shows property name instead of missing attribute name
- Mock test shows __getattr__ receives 'prop' not 'random_attr' when property fails

CODE_STATE:
- Target file: /tmp/tmp_qu0p03y/astropy/astropy/coordinates/sky_coordinate.py
- Key method: __getattr__ at line 869, error raised at lines 898-900
- Test script: /tmp/tmp_qu0p03y/astropy/reproduce_issue.py

TESTS: 
- Reproduction script confirms misleading error: "'custom_coord' object has no attribute 'prop'" instead of indicating 'random_attr' is missing
- Package build issues due to numpy compatibility, using mock implementation for testing

CHANGES: None yet

DEPS: astropy.coordinates module, numpy compatibility issues preventing full import

VERSION_CONTROL_STATUS: Working on local copy, no commits yet
